message_1: Find the limit of the function (2x+1)/(x-1) as x approaches 3.
message_2:
To find the limit of the function (2x+1)/(x-1) as x approaches 3, we can simply substitute the value of x with 3 and evaluate the function.

f(x) = (2x+1)/(x-1)

f(3) = (2(3)+1)/(3-1)
f(3) = (6+1)/(2)
f(3) = 7/2

So, the limit of the function (2x+1)/(x-1) as x approaches 3 is 7/2.
